text: A Syllabary is a writing system that uses symbols for syllables called syllabograms, as opposed to an alphabet which has letters to represent individual consonants and vowels. These syllables are often an optional consonant sound (C) followed by a vowel sound (V) â€” that is, a CV or V syllable, however, there are examples of syllabaries with symbols for CVC, CV- tone, and C (normally nasal consonants) syllables. == History == == Short list of Syllabaries == * Canadian Aboriginal syllabics * Cherokee * Japanese Kana (Hiragana, Katakana) * Linear B * Old Persian Cuneiform Category:Writing systems
title: Syllabary
